info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:12AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Macon and southwestern Jackson Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 112 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Franklin, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Lake Glenville, Ellijay, Cullasaja, Cowee and Tuckasegee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for western North Carolina.
